nodes.bodyText: I think we can skip filtering the replicas for "others" (and omit the code for that), since the resulting count/bytes values are the min/max of all replicas, including this one, either way.  If we loop over all replicas, the iteration for the current replica will be a "no-op", not change the result.
Good point, I missed that.  Thanks for the explanation.
Note: not a big deal, but it seems usedBytes and keyCount values are swapped compared to the original.
Ooops. That was not an intentional change. I will fix that just to keep things consistent with how they were before.
Prefer to keep the KeyCount and UsedKeys persist action here.
After looking at this area a bit more I understand why that is needed now. I have added those two lines back in.
